author: kahatlen
msg: DERBY-4582: Timestamps inserted with GMT calendar are 1 hour later
when subsequently read with GMT calendar (Server Mode Only)
Partial fix. This patch makes the server read time, date and timestamp
values from ResultSets and CallableStatements using the getter methods
that take a Calendar object. A GMT calendar is used, so that times
that are not possible to represent in the local time zone (like the
"lost hour" when switching to daylight saving time) are not silently
modified. The GMT calendar is also used when formatting the value
before it's sent to the client.

author: jacopoc
msg: Tag release 4.0.
The release has been created from the branch release4.0 (revision 935322) and has been officially voted in the dev list.
The results of the vote have been posted to the dev list on April 23 2010 in a mail with subject "[VOTE] [RESULT] [RELEASE] Apache OFBiz 4.0".
The vote has passed with the following result:
binding +1 votes: 7 (Ashish Vijaywargiya, Adrian Crum, Bruno Busco, Bilgin Ibryam, Anil Patel, Jacques Le Roux, Jacopo Cappellato)
non binding +1 votes: 4 (Michael Xu, BJ Freeman, Tim Ruppert, Sam Hamilton)
binding -1 votes: 1 (Scott Gray)
non binding -1 votes: 0
